chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So now let's see how to use SELECT statement and WHERE clause in SQL

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Before that let's know what is SELECT statement

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So we use SELECT statement when we want to retrieve or read data from a database

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Like we use SELECT in English, same word is used here

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: SELECT statement is used to select data from database

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And its syntax is SELECT, column name, FROM and table name

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: This way you can select data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: If you want all data in a table, like columns, rows, etc.

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Then we use asterisk sign, which is SELECT star FROM table

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: This way you can get all data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And third thing which is used a lot with SELECT statement is DISTINCT

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: DISTINCT means when you want unique values in a column

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Then you use DISTINCT

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Because it will remove all duplicate values and give you unique value

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So its syntax is SELECT, DISTINCT, COLUMN name, FROM and TABLE

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So let's understand it through an example

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So I am in a database, I write here

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: SELECT everything FROM classroom

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So this is my table

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: I am using asterisk sign, which means I want all data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: You select

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: This is all data in the classroom table

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: It has roll number, name, house and grade

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And it has data of 5 students

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So 5 rows of data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So this way you can select all data if you use asterisk sign

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now I want only some data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So I want only 2 columns

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: I want roll number and name

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you write those 2 columns

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And run it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now you can see only 2 columns are coming

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Roll number and name

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now if you want 3 columns

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you write comma here

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: GRADE

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And run it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you will get grade also

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So this way we can use SELECT statement

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now let's see DISTINCT

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So I want to see which all grades are DISTINCT

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So run it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now you can see in our entire data table

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: There are only 2 grades, A and B

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Means all are students

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So this way you can find DISTINCT and UNIQUE values

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now let's see what is WHERE clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So actually we use WHERE clause when we want to filter data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So we can filter data by putting condition in table

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And here it is written

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: It is used to extract only those records that fulfill the specified condition

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So whatever condition you put in it, it will filter the data and show you

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Its syntax is SELECT column name FROM table

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: After that WHERE and the condition you will write

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So here we write WHERE and whatever condition you want to write

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So let's see this example

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So here I have written that statement in SQL

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Before running it, let's understand the statement

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: SELECT name

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So from this table, it will only pick name column

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: This second column

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: After that FROM classroom

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Table name is done

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: WHERE grade equals to A

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So it will show only those students whose grade is A

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So before running it, let's see

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: There are only 2 students

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: One is RAM

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And second is SUNDAR

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: These are 2 students

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So let's run it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now you see only 2 names are there

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: RAM and SUNDAR

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So this way we use WHERE clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So when we want to use more than one condition in WHERE clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So for that we use operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So let's see the definition of operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So the words reserved in SQL or the characters reserved

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: We call them operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And we mostly use this with WHERE clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you get many operators in this

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: There are different types of operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: But the most used operators are 4

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Which you will use the most in SQL

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: One is Arithmetic Operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Second is Comparison Operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Third is Logical Operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And fourth is Bitwise Operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So what is Arithmetic

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: You can understand it from the name

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Arithmetic operations are used on your integer value or numerical values

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So there are some examples of it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Like addition, plus symbol, subtraction, minus symbol

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: In this way, multiplication, division and modulus

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And what is Comparison Operator

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: It is used to compare any 2 data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So for example, we put sign of equals to

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Not equals sign

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Greater than, less than

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Smaller than, greater than

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: All these signs

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And the third is Logical Operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: In this, you perform Boolean operations

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Like you use all condition, in condition, between condition

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So if it is false, it will not give data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: If it is true, it will give you data in the output

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Then comes Bitwise Operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So what you do in this

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: The bit operation you perform on the integer value

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Then we use Bitwise Operators

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Like AND and OR

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So for Bitwise AND, we use AND symbol

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And for Bitwise OR, we use single pipe

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So let's do an example

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So the last statement we used for where clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: In that, we put AND condition

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So I write AND

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And here I say, the roll number is

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Greater than 3

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So bigger than 3

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: If someone has A grade in 4 or 5, then he should tell me

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Let's run it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Only one answer should come

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: That is Sundar

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you can see, only one child's name has come

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Which is Sundar

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So here we have used two conditions

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: If I want all the data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Like Sundar's name, roll number, grade, everything

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So here you put star

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And then run it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you see, now all the data is given

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Roll number is 4

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Because we had taken condition

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Roll number should be greater than 3

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So it will not include 3, but greater than 3

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So there is only one child in it, Sundar, whose grade is A

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And that is Agni House

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So all the details come like this

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So like this, you can use multiple conditions

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: In where clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So like we have put two conditions in where clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Where grade is equal to A and roll number is greater than 3

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: If you want to put more conditions

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Then you can write AND here

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And add that condition

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you can put as many conditions as you want

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So like we are learning where clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So there are two more clauses

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: With where clause

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: One is limit clause and other is order by

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you will use it a lot

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So let's see it quickly

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So limit clause helps you

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: To see how many rows you want to see

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: When you want to go to output

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And order by clause helps you to sort the data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So let's understand it through an example

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So as you can see

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: There is a table named customer

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So now this data is sorted on the basis of customer ID

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So now I want it to be sorted on the basis of name

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So what I will do

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Select everything here

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: From and I will say

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Order by

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: First name

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: If you want ascending

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Then you will write ASC

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And if you want descending then you will write DESC

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So I want ascending

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So you can see that Mary is on top

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: It will change now

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Let's run

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now you can see that Barbara is on top

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Because there is no one above B

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Then there is B, then D, then E

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And at last S

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So like this you can sort the data with the help of order by

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And if we talk about limit

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So as you can see

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: There is a top 5 data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And if I use limit

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And I say 5

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Sorry limit

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: And I write 5

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: If you run it, then it will show only 5 rows of data

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Let's run it

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: Now you can see that it is showing only top 5

chunks.title: SELECT Statement & WHERE Clause with Exam
chunks.text: So this is the use of limit

text: So now let's see how to use SELECT statement and WHERE clause in SQL Before that let's know what is SELECT statement So we use SELECT statement when we want to retrieve or read data from a database Like we use SELECT in English, same word is used here SELECT statement is used to select data from database And its syntax is SELECT, column name, FROM and table name This way you can select data If you want all data in a table, like columns, rows, etc. Then we use asterisk sign, which is SELECT star FROM table This way you can get all data And third thing which is used a lot with SELECT statement is DISTINCT DISTINCT means when you want unique values in a column Then you use DISTINCT Because it will remove all duplicate values and give you unique value So its syntax is SELECT, DISTINCT, COLUMN name, FROM and TABLE So let's understand it through an example So I am in a database, I write here SELECT everything FROM classroom So this is my table I am using asterisk sign, which means I want all data You select This is all data in the classroom table It has roll number, name, house and grade And it has data of 5 students So 5 rows of data So this way you can select all data if you use asterisk sign Now I want only some data So I want only 2 columns I want roll number and name So you write those 2 columns And run it Now you can see only 2 columns are coming Roll number and name Now if you want 3 columns So you write comma here GRADE And run it So you will get grade also So this way we can use SELECT statement Now let's see DISTINCT So I want to see which all grades are DISTINCT So run it Now you can see in our entire data table There are only 2 grades, A and B Means all are students So this way you can find DISTINCT and UNIQUE values Now let's see what is WHERE clause So actually we use WHERE clause when we want to filter data So we can filter data by putting condition in table And here it is written It is used to extract only those records that fulfill the specified condition So whatever condition you put in it, it will filter the data and show you Its syntax is SELECT column name FROM table After that WHERE and the condition you will write So here we write WHERE and whatever condition you want to write So let's see this example So here I have written that statement in SQL Before running it, let's understand the statement SELECT name So from this table, it will only pick name column This second column After that FROM classroom Table name is done WHERE grade equals to A So it will show only those students whose grade is A So before running it, let's see There are only 2 students One is RAM And second is SUNDAR These are 2 students So let's run it Now you see only 2 names are there RAM and SUNDAR So this way we use WHERE clause So when we want to use more than one condition in WHERE clause So for that we use operators So let's see the definition of operators So the words reserved in SQL or the characters reserved We call them operators And we mostly use this with WHERE clause So you get many operators in this There are different types of operators But the most used operators are 4 Which you will use the most in SQL One is Arithmetic Operators Second is Comparison Operators Third is Logical Operators And fourth is Bitwise Operators So what is Arithmetic You can understand it from the name Arithmetic operations are used on your integer value or numerical values So there are some examples of it Like addition, plus symbol, subtraction, minus symbol In this way, multiplication, division and modulus And what is Comparison Operator It is used to compare any 2 data So for example, we put sign of equals to Not equals sign Greater than, less than Smaller than, greater than All these signs And the third is Logical Operators In this, you perform Boolean operations Like you use all condition, in condition, between condition So if it is false, it will not give data If it is true, it will give you data in the output Then comes Bitwise Operators So what you do in this The bit operation you perform on the integer value Then we use Bitwise Operators Like AND and OR So for Bitwise AND, we use AND symbol And for Bitwise OR, we use single pipe So let's do an example So the last statement we used for where clause In that, we put AND condition So I write AND And here I say, the roll number is Greater than 3 So bigger than 3 If someone has A grade in 4 or 5, then he should tell me Let's run it Only one answer should come That is Sundar So you can see, only one child's name has come Which is Sundar So here we have used two conditions If I want all the data Like Sundar's name, roll number, grade, everything So here you put star And then run it So you see, now all the data is given Roll number is 4 Because we had taken condition Roll number should be greater than 3 So it will not include 3, but greater than 3 So there is only one child in it, Sundar, whose grade is A And that is Agni House So all the details come like this So like this, you can use multiple conditions In where clause So like we have put two conditions in where clause Where grade is equal to A and roll number is greater than 3 If you want to put more conditions Then you can write AND here And add that condition So you can put as many conditions as you want So like we are learning where clause So there are two more clauses With where clause One is limit clause and other is order by So you will use it a lot So let's see it quickly So limit clause helps you To see how many rows you want to see When you want to go to output And order by clause helps you to sort the data So let's understand it through an example So as you can see There is a table named customer So now this data is sorted on the basis of customer ID So now I want it to be sorted on the basis of name So what I will do Select everything here From and I will say Order by First name If you want ascending Then you will write ASC And if you want descending then you will write DESC So I want ascending So you can see that Mary is on top It will change now Let's run Now you can see that Barbara is on top Because there is no one above B Then there is B, then D, then E And at last S So like this you can sort the data with the help of order by And if we talk about limit So as you can see There is a top 5 data And if I use limit And I say 5 Sorry limit And I write 5 If you run it, then it will show only 5 rows of data Let's run it Now you can see that it is showing only top 5 So this is the use of limit
